intro: Kickxia dentata, commonly known as the toothed knotweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, toothed leaves and clusters of small, pink to reddish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Kickxia dentata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
